gov.usgs.volcanoes.core.time

Class Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.volcanoes.core.time.Time

  • public final class Time
extends Object
    A utility class for dealing with time, especially formatting and J2Ks.
    Author:
    Dan Cervelli, Tom Parker

      • FDSN_TIME_FORMAT

        public static final String FDSN_TIME_FORMAT
        format used by the FDSNWS standard. Almost, but not quite, ISO. This doesn't really belong here.

      • getFormat

        protected static SimpleDateFormat getFormat(String format)
        Searches in internal formats list.
        Parameters:
        format - Format name to search
        Returns:
        Found SimpleDateFormat or, if absent, initialized with fs string one

      • getRelativeTime

        public static double getRelativeTime(String timeStr)
        Converts a Valve style relative time to a number of seconds. First character must be '-', then a number, then one of these characters: s, i, h, d, w, y.
        Parameters:
        timeStr - the time string
        Returns:
        the number of seconds this represents (or NaN on error)

      • j2kToEw

        public static double j2kToEw(double j2k)
        Convert a J2kSec to Ew.
        Parameters:
        j2k - Date as J2kSec
        Returns:
        date as Ew

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception

        Main class method.

        Usage:

        without arguments - prints usage message

        -j2d [j2k] j2k to date

        -d2j [yyyymmddhhmmss] date to j2k

        -e2d [ewtime] earthworm to date

        -md5 [string] md5 of string

        -md5r [resource] md5 of a resource (filename, url)

        Parameters:
        args - command line args
        Throws:
        Exception - when things go wrong

      • parseTimeRange

        public static double[] parseTimeRange(String timeRange)
                               throws ParseException
        TODO: convert to TimeSpan class
        Parameters:
        timeRange - two string dates in "yyyyMMddHHmmss" format or relative time, divided by comma.
        Returns:
        array of two doubles - start and end J2K dates
        Throws:
        ParseException - when the string looks odd

      • secondsToString

        public static String secondsToString(double diff)
        Returns a string of this format: "#d #h #m #s" representing the amount of time between two dates.
        Parameters:
        diff - the difference (seconds)
        Returns:
        the string representing this difference

      • getMonthsBetween

        public static int getMonthsBetween(Date ds,
                   Date de)
        Gets the number of months between two Date objects. The number of months between two dates in the same month in the same year is 0.
        Parameters:
        ds - the starting date
        de - the ending date
        Returns:
        the number of months
